catalog_info.title: Environmental History of South Asia
catalog_info.description: This seminar explores approaches to the environmental history of modern South Asia. It is designed for graduate students preparing examination fields in Modern and Contemporary South Asian Studies and in South Asian History; it might also be of interest as a comparative perspective for those specializing in the environmental history of other parts of the world. Topics and readings will be tailored to students’ individual interests, but are likely to include: changing human interactions with the natural environment; the role of colonial and post-colonial states in environmental transformation; and the development of Indian environmental law and regulation.
